summary: In this context, 1,1,2-trichloroethene (TCE) is mentioned as a chlorinated solvent, which is categorized alongside hydrocarbons such as gasoline and diesel fuel as common contaminants in subsurface environments. Both TCE and hydrocarbons are highlighted as significant pollutants, but the context does not delve into their specific interactions or relationships beyond their shared status as environmental contaminants.
